text: 発令 / 書 承認 / さすがマヤ、早いわね / それはもう先輩の直伝ですから
translation: Order issued / Document approved / As expected of Maya, that was fast / Well, I learned directly from my senior
grammar: The pattern 'さすが + [noun]' expresses admiration meaning 'as expected of [someone]'. The もう in それはもう adds emphasis like 'well, that's because...'

text: あ、待ってそこ、A8の方が早いわよ / ちょっと貸して
translation: Ah, wait - there, A8 would be faster / Let me borrow that
grammar: Xの方が + adjective is the standard comparative structure, meaning 'X is more [adjective]'. ちょっと貸して is a casual request form.

text: さすが先輩 / どう?マギの診察は終わった?
translation: As expected of a senior / How is it? Is MAGI's checkup finished?
grammar: The た form + か creates a past tense question. Here 診察 (medical checkup) is used metaphorically for computer maintenance.

text: だいたいね、約束通り今日のテストには間に合わせたわよ
translation: Pretty much done - as promised, I made it in time for today's test

vocabulary.meaning: to make it in time, to manage somehow

grammar: X通り means 'as per X' or 'according to X'. The わよ ending is feminine assertive speech.

text: さすがリツコ、同じものが3つもあって大変なのに / 冷めてるわよそれ
translation: As expected of Ritsuko, even though having three of the same thing must be tough / That's gone cold, you know
grammar: のに at the end of a clause expresses 'even though' or 'despite'. The も after 3つ adds emphasis meaning 'as many as three'.

text: マギシステム / 3機とも自己診断モードに入りました
translation: MAGI System / All three units have entered self-diagnostic mode
grammar: Xとも means 'all X' or 'both X'. When combined with a number, it indicates all of that quantity (3機とも = all three units).

text: 第127時定期検診異常なし / 了解おつからさま / みんなテスト開始まで休んでしょうね
translation: 127th regular checkup - no abnormalities / Roger, good work / Everyone rest until the test starts
grammar: 異常なし is a terse report-style phrase meaning 'no abnormalities'. おつかれさま (shortened to おつからさま) is a set phrase acknowledging someone's work.

text: 異常なしか / 母さんは今日も元気なのに
translation: No abnormalities, huh... / Mother is still healthy today, and yet...
grammar: のに at the end suggests an unspoken contrast or complaint - here implying 'mother is fine, but I...' The か at the end of a statement indicates reflection or mild surprise.

text: 私はただ年を取るだけなのかしらね
translation: I wonder if I'm just getting older...
grammar: かしら is a feminine wondering particle, similar to かな but more refined. The combination だけなのかしらね expresses wistful self-reflection.

text: 姿になったわよ!17回も赤を落とされてね!
translation: You ended up in that state! You failed the red 17 times!
grammar: も after a number emphasizes a surprisingly large quantity ('as many as 17 times'). The passive 落とされて indicates being failed/dropped by someone else.

text: では3人とも、この部屋を抜けて、その姿のままエントリープラグに入ってちょうだい! / えぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇぇ
translation: Now then, all three of you, leave this room and enter the Entry Plug as you are! / Whaaaat?!
grammar: Xのまま means 'while remaining X' or 'as X is'. ちょうだい is a softer, more feminine form of ください for requests.

text: ぇ
translation: (continued scream)
grammar: Extended vowel sound indicating a prolonged exclamation of shock.

text: 各パイロット、エントリー準備完了しました / テストスタート / テストスタートします / オートパイロット、記憶開始
translation: All pilots, entry preparation complete / Test start / Starting test / Autopilot, beginning recording
grammar: 各 is a formal prefix meaning 'each/every'. The しました form is polite past tense, common in formal announcements.

text: シミュレーションプラグを挿入
translation: Inserting simulation plug
grammar: The を + noun pattern without a verb is common in technical/military commands, implying the action is being performed.

text: システムをモギ隊と接続します
translation: Connecting system with MAGI
grammar: AをBと接続する is a standard pattern for 'connect A with B'. The します form indicates an action about to be performed.

text: シミュレーションプラグ、マギの制御下に入りました / おー、早い早 / い / マギ様様だわ
translation: Simulation plug has entered MAGI's control / Oh, that's fast / Thank goodness for MAGI
grammar: X様様 is an expression meaning 'thank goodness for X' or 'I owe it all to X'. 制御下に入る means 'to come under control of'.

text: 初実験の時、1週間もかかったのが嘘のようね / テストは約3時間で終わる予定です
translation: It's hard to believe it took a whole week during the first experiment / The test is scheduled to finish in about 3 hours

vocabulary.meaning: seems like a lie, hard to believe

grammar: Xのが嘘のよう expresses disbelief about X. The pattern Xで終わる予定 means 'scheduled to finish in/at X'.

text: 気分はどう? / 何か違うわ / うん、いつもと違う気がする / 感覚がおかしいのよ
translation: How do you feel? / Something's different / Yeah, it feels different from usual / My senses feel strange
grammar: Xと違う means 'different from X'. 気がする means 'to feel like' or 'to have a sense that'.

text: 右腕だけはっきりして、あとはぼやけた感じ / レイ、右手を動かすイメージを描いてみて / はい
translation: Only my right arm is clear, the rest feels blurry / Rei, try to visualize moving your right hand / Yes
grammar: Xだけ means 'only X'. イメージを描く literally means 'to draw an image' but here means 'to visualize'. てみて is a request to try doing something.

text: データ収集、順調です / 問題はないよね。マギを通常に戻して。
translation: Data collection is going smoothly / There's no problem, right? Return MAGI to normal mode.
grammar: よね at the end seeks confirmation from the listener. Xに戻す means 'to return to X' (causative - making something return).

text: ジレンマか。
translation: A dilemma, huh.
grammar: The か at the end of a statement without rising intonation indicates contemplation or talking to oneself.

text: 作った人間の性格が伺えるわね。 / 何言ってんの?作ったのはあんたでしょ? / あなたは何も知らないのね。
translation: You can tell the personality of the person who made it. / What are you saying? You're the one who made it, aren't you? / You don't know anything, do you.

vocabulary.meaning: can perceive, can tell (humble potential form)

grammar: Xが伺える means 'one can perceive X'. でしょ at the end seeks strong confirmation ('isn't that right?'). 何も知らない means 'knows nothing'.

text: リツコが私みたくベラベラと自分のこと話さないからでしょ? / そうね。 / 私はシステムアップしただけ。
translation: It's because Ritsuko doesn't talk about herself openly like me, right? / That's right. / I only upgraded the system.

vocabulary.meaning: like (casual form of みたいに)

grammar: Xみたく is casual speech for Xみたいに meaning 'like X'. からでしょ indicates 'it's because X, right?'. だけ means 'only/just'.

text: 基礎理論と本体を作ったのは、母さんよ。
translation: The one who created the basic theory and the main body was my mother.
grammar: Xたのは...だ is a cleft sentence pattern emphasizing who did X. The よ at the end adds assertion/emphasis.

text: 確認してるんだな / ええ、一応 / 3日前に搬入されたパーツです / ここですね、変質してるのは / 第87タンパクエリ / か
translation: So you're checking it / Yes, just in case / It's a part that was brought in three days ago / Here it is, the part that's deteriorating / Protein wall 87 / I see
grammar: 一応 means 'just in case' or 'tentatively'. Xされた is passive form meaning 'was X-ed'. のは identifies what is being talked about.

text: 拡大するとシミのようなものがあります / 何でしょうね、これ / 新色だろ / 温度と電導率が若干変化しています / 無菌質の劣化はよくあるんです、最近
translation: When magnified, there's something like a stain / What could this be? / Probably just discoloration / Temperature and conductivity have changed slightly / Deterioration of sterile material has been common lately
grammar: Xすると means 'when you do X'. Xのようなもの means 'something like X'. 若干 means 'slightly'. よくある means 'happens often'.

text: 後期が60日近く圧縮されてますから / また気泡が混ざっていたんでしょう
translation: The schedule was compressed by nearly 60 days / Air bubbles probably got mixed in again
grammar: X近く means 'nearly X'. てますから explains the reason. んでしょう expresses probability/conjecture.

text: ずさんですよB棟の工事は / そこは使徒が現れてからの工事だからな / 無理ないっすよ / みんな疲れてますからね / 明日までに処理しておけ / 怒りがうるさいからな
translation: The construction in Building B is sloppy / Well, that construction started after the Angels appeared / It can't be helped / Everyone's tired / Handle it by tomorrow / The higher-ups are being noisy about it
grammar: Xてからの means 'since X happened'. 無理ない means 'it can't be helped'. ておけ is a command form of ておく (to do in preparation).

text: 了解
translation: Understood
grammar: Standard military/professional acknowledgment. Short and direct.

text: また水漏れ? / いえ侵食だそうです / この上のタンパク壁 / 参ったわね / テストにしようは? / 今のところは何も / では続けて
translation: Another water leak? / No, apparently it's corrosion. / The protein wall above here. / This is troublesome. / Any effect on the test? / Nothing so far. / Then continue.

vocabulary.meaning: to be troubled, to give up

grammar: 参ったわね uses the feminine sentence-ending particle わね to express shared concern or frustration.

text: このテストはおいそれと中断するわけにはいかないわ / 怒り指令もうるさいし / 了解
translation: We can't just casually interrupt this test. / And the Commander is being difficult about it. / Understood.
grammar: わけにはいかない expresses that something cannot be done due to circumstances or social expectations - 'cannot possibly' or 'it won't do to'.

text: シンクロ位置正常 / シミュレーションプラグを模擬隊経由でエヴァ本体と接続します
translation: Synchronization position normal. / Connecting simulation plug to Eva main unit via the dummy system.
grammar: 経由で indicates the route or intermediary through which something passes - 'via' or 'by way of'.

text: エヴァ0号機コンタクト確認 / ATフィールド出力2オクトで発生します
translation: Eva Unit-00 contact confirmed. / AT Field generating at 2 oct output.
grammar: で発生します uses で to indicate the means or manner in which the AT Field is generated.

text: どう / したの? / シグマユニットAフロアに汚染警報発令 / 第87タンパク壁が劣化 / 発熱しています / 第6パイプにも異常発生
translation: What's / wrong? / Contamination alert issued on Sigma Unit A Floor. / Protein wall 87 is deteriorating. / It's generating heat. / Anomaly also occurring in Pipe 6.
grammar: にも means 'also in/at' - the も emphasizes that the anomaly is appearing in yet another location.

text: タンパク壁の侵食部が増殖しています / 爆発的スピードです / 実験中止 / 第6パイプを / 緊急閉鎖 / はい
translation: The corroded part of the protein wall is multiplying. / At explosive speed! / Abort the experiment! / Emergency closure / of Pipe 6! / Yes!
grammar: 的 (てき) is a suffix that converts nouns to na-adjectives, similar to '-ic' or '-ive' in English.

text: 60、38、39 / 閉鎖されました / 6の42に侵食発生 / ダメです
translation: 60, 38, 39 / Closed! / Corrosion occurring in 6-42! / It's no good!
grammar: されました is the polite passive form of する, indicating that sections were closed (by someone/the system).

text: 侵食は壁伝いに進行しています / ポリソーム用意!
translation: The corrosion is progressing along the walls! / Prepare the polysome!
grammar: 伝い (づたい) is a suffix meaning 'along' or 'following', attached to nouns to indicate movement along something.

text: レーザー出力最大! 侵入と同時に発車!
translation: Laser output maximum! Fire simultaneously with entry!
grammar: と同時に means 'at the same time as' or 'simultaneously with', connecting two concurrent actions.

text: 侵食部658に到達!来
translation: Reached corroded section 658! It's com-
grammar: に到達 uses に to mark the destination or target that was reached.

text: ます!レ
translation: -ing! Re-
grammar: This is a continuation of the previous segment, with speech being cut off mid-word.

text: イ!
translation: -i! (Rei!)
grammar: The name Rei is being called out urgently, split across segments for dramatic effect.

text: レイの模擬隊が動いています / まさか
translation: Rei's dummy system is moving! / No way...
grammar: まさか expresses disbelief or shock, often left as an incomplete sentence to convey stunned reaction.

text: 新速度さらに拡大 / 模擬隊の活水システムを犯しています
translation: Spread rate expanding further! / It's attacking the dummy system's life support!
grammar: さらに means 'further' or 'even more', intensifying the verb that follows.

text: レイは? / うちです / 全プラグを緊急射出 / レイザー急いで
translation: What about Rei? / She's inside! / Emergency ejection of all plugs! / Hurry with the laser!
grammar: 急いで is the te-form of 急ぐ, used here as an imperative urging someone to hurry.

text: エーティフィールド! / まさか!
translation: AT Field! / No way!
grammar: まさか is repeated to express shock at the unexpected appearance of an AT Field.

text: なに? / これ / 分析パターンは青 / 間違いなく死とよ
translation: What? / This... / Analysis pattern is blue. / It's definitely an Angel.
grammar: 間違いなく is an adverb meaning 'without mistake' or 'definitely', emphasizing certainty.

text: シト、シトの侵入を許したのか? / 申し訳ありません / 言い訳はいい
translation: An Angel... We allowed an Angel to infiltrate? / I'm terribly sorry. / I don't need excuses.

vocabulary.reading: もうしわけありません

grammar: を許したのか uses the past tense with the question particle か to express shock and disbelief about what has happened.

text: セントラルドグマを物理閉鎖、シグマユニットと隔離しろ / セ / ントラルドグマを物理閉鎖、シグマユニットと / 隔離します / ボクスを破棄します!総員退避!
translation: Physically seal off Central Dogma and isolate it from the Sigma Unit! / Physically sealing Central Dogma, / isolating from Sigma Unit! / Abandoning the box! All personnel evacuate!
grammar: しろ is the imperative form of する, giving a direct command.

text: 何 / してるの?早く!
translation: What / are you doing? Hurry!
grammar: してるの is a casual contraction of しているの, with の adding an explanatory or questioning nuance.

text: SIGMAユニットBフロアより隔離します / 全核引き寄せるが / 該当地区は総員退避 / 分かってる / よろしく頼む
translation: Isolating from Sigma Unit B Floor. / Drawing all power. / All personnel evacuate from the affected area. / I understand. / I'm counting on you.
grammar: よろしく頼む is a common expression meaning 'I'm counting on you' or 'please take care of it'.

text: 警報を止めろ / 警報 / を停止します
translation: Stop the alarm! / Stopping / the alarm.
grammar: 止めろ is the imperative form of 止める, expressing a direct command.

text: 誤報だ / 探知機のミスだ / 日本政府と委員会にはそう伝えろ / はい / 汚染区域はさらに加工 / プリムのボックスから / SIGMAユニット全域へと広がっています / 場所がまずいぞ
translation: It's a false alarm. / A detector malfunction. / Report it that way to the Japanese government and the committee. / Yes sir. / The contaminated area is spreading further / from Pribnow Box / to the entire Sigma Unit. / The location is bad.
grammar: へと広がっています uses へと to indicate direction of spread, with ています showing ongoing action.

text: ああ、アダムに近すぎる。 / 汚染はシグマユニットまでで抑えろ。
translation: Yes, it's too close to Adam. / Contain the contamination to the Sigma Unit.
grammar: すぎる attached to adjective stems means 'too much' - 近すぎる means 'too close'.

text: ジオフロントは犠牲にしても構わん。エヴァは? / 第7刑事にて待機。パイロットを回収次第発進できます。 / パイロットを待つ / 必要はない。すぐ地上へ射出しろ。 / え?
translation: We can sacrifice the Geo-Front if necessary. What about the Evas? / Standing by at Cage 7. They can launch as soon as pilots are recovered. / There's no need / to wait for the pilots. Eject them to the surface immediately. / What?
grammar: 次第 after a verb stem means 'as soon as' - 回収次第 means 'as soon as recovered'.

text: 初号機を最優先だ。そのために他の2機は破棄しても構わん。 / 初号機をですか? / しかし、エ / ヴ / ァなしでは、使徒を物理的に殲滅 / できません。
translation: Unit-01 is top priority. We can discard the other two units for that purpose. / Unit-01? / But without / the / Evas, we can't physically annihilate / the Angels.
grammar: ても構わん is a masculine/gruff contraction of ても構わない meaning 'it doesn't matter if' or 'it's fine even if'.

text: その前にエヴァを汚染されたらすべて終わりだ。 / 急げ!
translation: If the Evas are contaminated before that, everything is over. / Hurry!
grammar: されたら is the passive conditional form - 'if [something] is done to [subject]'. Here it expresses 'if the Evas are contaminated'.

text: ほら、ここが重水の境目。酸素の多いところよ。 / 好みが / はっきりしてます / ね。
translation: Look, this is the boundary of the heavy water. Where there's a lot of oxygen. / Its preferences / are quite clear, / aren't they.
grammar: ところ after a clause describes 'the place/situation where' - 酸素の多いところ means 'places where oxygen is abundant'.

text: 無菌状態維持のため、オゾンを噴出しているところは汚染されていません。 / つまり、酸素に弱いってこと? / らしいわね。
translation: Areas spraying ozone to maintain sterility haven't been contaminated. / So you mean it's weak against oxygen? / Apparently so.
grammar: ってこと is a casual way to confirm understanding, short for ということ - 'you mean that...?' or 'so it's that...?'

text: オゾン注入 / 濃度増加しています / 効いてる効いてる
translation: Ozone injection. / Concentration is increasing. / It's working, it's working!
grammar: Repeating a verb (効いてる効いてる) adds emphasis and excitement, showing real-time observation.

text: いける / か
translation: Can we do this? / Hmm...

vocabulary.meaning: to be able to manage, to work out

grammar: いける is casual potential form meaning 'it can work' or 'we can do this'. The か at the end adds uncertainty.

text: 0Aと0Bは回復しそうです / パイプ周り正常地に戻りました / やはり中心部は強いですね / よしオ / ゾンを増やせ
translation: 0A and 0B look like they'll recover. / The pipe area has returned to normal. / As expected, the central part is strong. / Alright, increase the ozone!
grammar: 〜そうです expresses conjecture based on appearance ('looks like it will...'). 増やせ is imperative form of 増やす.

text: 変ね
translation: That's strange...
grammar: ね at the end seeks confirmation or expresses contemplation. 変ね is a common expression of puzzlement.

text: あれ / 増えてるぞ! / 変です! 発熱が高まってます! / 汚染域! また拡大しています!
translation: Huh? / It's increasing! / Something's wrong! The heat is rising! / The contaminated area! It's expanding again!
grammar: ぞ is a masculine sentence-ending particle adding emphasis and urgency. てる is casual form of ている.

text: ダメです! まるで効 / 果がなくなりました! / 今度はオゾンをどんどん吸っています! / オゾン止めて!
translation: No good! It's become completely ineffective! / Now it's rapidly absorbing the ozone! / Stop the ozone!
grammar: まるで...ない means 'not at all' or 'completely not'. どんどん is an onomatopoeia expressing rapid progression.

text: すごい… 進化しているんだわ…
translation: Incredible... It's evolving...
grammar: んだわ is feminine sentence ending expressing realization or explanation. The ん (explanatory の) adds emotional weight.

text: どうしたの!? / サブコンピューターがハッキングを受けています! 侵入者不明! / こんな時に… くそ! Cモードで対応!
translation: What happened!? / The sub-computer is being hacked! Intruder unknown! / At a time like this... Damn! Respond with C-Mode!
grammar: を受けています is passive progressive, showing ongoing action being done to the subject.

text: 防兵器を解凍します! 疑似エントリー展開! / 疑似エントリーを開始されました / 逆端まで18秒 / 防壁を展開 / 防壁を突破されました / 疑似エントリーをさらに展開します / 人間技じゃないぞ
translation: Thawing defensive weapons! Deploying decoy entry! / Decoy entry has begun. / 18 seconds until breach. / Deploying firewall. / Firewall breached! / Deploying additional decoy entries. / This is superhuman!
grammar: 人間技じゃない literally means 'not human skill/technique' - an expression meaning something is beyond human capability.

text: 逆端に成功 / この施設内です / B棟の地下 / プリブローボックスです
translation: Backtrace successful. / It's within this facility. / Basement of Building B. / It's in the Pribnow Box.
grammar: Noun + に成功 means 'succeeded in (noun)'. 施設内 uses 内 (ない) as suffix meaning 'within'.

text: 光学模様が変化しています / 光ってるラインは電子回路だ / こりゃコンピューターそのものだ / 疑似エ / ントリー展開 / 失敗 妨害されました / メインケーブルを切断
translation: The optical pattern is changing. / The glowing lines are electronic circuits. / This thing IS a computer! / Decoy entry deployment failed - we were blocked. / Cut the main cable!
grammar: そのもの after a noun emphasizes 'the thing itself' or 'nothing but'. こりゃ is casual contraction of これは.

text: ダメです 命令を受け付けません / レーザー打ち込んで / ATフィールド発生 効果なし / 保安部のメインバンクにアクセスしています / パスワードを操作中
translation: No good, it's not accepting commands! / Fire the laser! / AT Field generated - no effect. / It's accessing the security department's main bank. / Manipulating passwords.

vocabulary.meaning: to fire into, to drive in

grammar: 〜中 (ちゅう) after a verb stem or noun means 'in the middle of doing'. 効果なし is telegraphic speech omitting particles.

text: 12桁 16桁 Dワードクリア / 保安部のメインバンクに侵入されました
translation: 12 digits, 16 digits, D-word cleared! / Security department's main bank has been infiltrated!
grammar: Passive form されました indicates the action was done to them (the bank was infiltrated by an outside force).

text: メインバンクを読んでます 解除できません / 奴の目的は何だ / メインバスを探っています / このコードは / ヤバい! マギに侵入するつもりだ!
translation: It's reading the main bank - we can't cancel it! / What is its objective? / It's probing the main bus. / This code is... / This is bad! It intends to infiltrate MAGI!
grammar: 〜つもりだ expresses intention. ヤバい is slang for 'dangerous/bad' (or 'awesome' in modern casual use).

text: Ioシステムをダウンしろ
translation: Shut down the I/O system!
grammar: しろ is the imperative form of する, used for direct commands. Very forceful and urgent.

text: カウントどうぞ! / 3、2、1!
translation: Begin countdown! / 3, 2, 1!
grammar: どうぞ here functions as 'go ahead' or 'please proceed', giving permission to start.

text: 弦弦が切れません! / シト、さらに侵入! レルピオレに接触しました!
translation: The connection won't disconnect! / The Angel is infiltrating further! It's contacted Melchior!
grammar: 〜ません shows negative potential - 'cannot cut/disconnect'. さらに intensifies the ongoing action.

text: ダメです! シトに乗っ取られます!
translation: No good! It's being taken over by the Angel!

vocabulary.meaning: to take over, to hijack, to seize control

grammar: 乗っ取られます is passive form indicating the subject (MAGI) will be taken over by the Angel.

text: メルキオール、使徒にリプログラムされました
translation: Melchior has been reprogrammed by the Angel.
grammar: Passive construction に...されました shows the Angel (使徒) as the agent performing the action on Melchior.

text: 人工地のメルキオールより、 / 自立自爆が提訴されました / 秘訣、 / 秘訣、秘訣
translation: From the AI Melchior, / self-destruct has been proposed. / Denied. / Denied, denied.
grammar: より is formal equivalent of から meaning 'from'. されました is passive showing the proposal was made.

text: こ、今度はメルキオールがバルタザールをハッキングしています
translation: N-now Melchior is hacking Balthasar!
grammar: The stuttering こ、今度 shows the speaker's shock and distress. ています shows ongoing action.

text: くそ、早い
translation: Damn, it's fast!
grammar: Minimal sentence structure typical of urgent situations - just expletive + adjective.

text: なんて計算することだ
translation: What incredible processing speed!
grammar: なんて...ことだ is an exclamatory pattern expressing amazement or disbelief at something.

text: ロジックモードを変更 / シンクロコードを15秒単位にして / 了解
translation: Change the logic mode. / Set the sync code to 15-second intervals. / Understood.
grammar: 〜にして means 'set to' or 'make it into'. 単位 after a time expression indicates intervals.

text: どのくらい持ちそうだ / 今までのスピードから見て / 2時間くらいは / マギが / 敵に回るとはな
translation: How long do you think we can hold out? / Judging from the speed so far... / About 2 hours. / To think MAGI would become our enemy...
grammar: 〜とはな is a sentence ending expressing surprise or disbelief at an unexpected situation. 敵に回る means 'to turn into an enemy'.

text: 彼らはマイクロマシン 細菌体制の使徒と考えられます
translation: They can be considered micro-machines - an Angel in bacterial form.

vocabulary.meaning: can be considered, thought to be

grammar: 〜と考えられます is passive potential meaning 'can be thought of as' - formal analytical language.

text: その個体が集まって群れを作り / この短時間で知能回路の形成に至るまで 爆発的な進化を遂げています / 進化か / はい
translation: Those individual units gather and form swarms, / and in this short time have achieved explosive evolution to the point of forming intelligence circuits. / Evolution, huh? / Yes.
grammar: 〜に至るまで means 'to the point of reaching'. 爆発的な is な-adjective meaning 'explosive'.

text: 彼らは常に自分自身を変化させ / いかなる状況にも対処するシステムを模索しています / まさに生物の生きるためのシステムそのものだな / 事故の弱点を克服
translation: They constantly change themselves / and are seeking a system to deal with any situation. / That's exactly what a living organism's survival system is. / Overcoming their own weaknesses.
grammar: いかなる〜にも means 'in any (situation)' - formal/literary expression. まさに emphasizes 'exactly' or 'precisely'.

text: 進化を続ける目標に対して有効な手段は / 死なばもろとも
translation: An effective means against a target that continues to evolve... / If we die, we take it with us.
grammar: 死なばもろとも is a classical expression meaning 'if we die, we die together' - mutual destruction. 死なば is classical conditional of 死ぬ.

text: 拒否します / 技術部が解決すべき問題です / なに意地張ってんのよ
translation: I refuse. This is a problem the Technical Department should solve. / Why are you being so stubborn?

vocabulary.meaning: to be stubborn, to be obstinate

grammar: べき問題 - 'べき' after verb stem indicates obligation or expectation ('a problem that should be solved')

text: 私のミスから始まったことなのよ / あなたは昔からそう / 一人で全部抱え込んで / 他人を宛にしないのね
translation: This started from my mistake. / You've always been like that. / Taking everything on yourself alone. / You don't rely on others, do you?

vocabulary.meaning: to take on (by oneself), to hold in
to rely on, to count on

grammar: から始まった - indicates the origin/starting point of something ('started from')

text: 人が進化し続けるのなら / 賞賛はあります / 進化の促進かね
translation: If it continues to evolve... / There is a chance. / Accelerating its evolution, you mean?
grammar: し続けるのなら - conditional form with 続ける indicating 'if it keeps doing...'

text: はい / 終着地点は自滅、死そのものだ
translation: Yes. / The final destination is self-destruction - death itself.
grammar: そのもの - emphasizer meaning 'itself' or 'the very thing'

text: ならば、進化をこちらで促進させてやればいいわけか?
translation: Then, we just need to accelerate its evolution on our end?
grammar: させてやればいいわけか - causative + てやる (doing for someone) + ばいい (should just do) + わけか (is that the reasoning?)

text: 使徒が死の効率的な回避を考えれば、マギトの共生を選択するかもしれません / でも、どうやって…
translation: If the Angel considers efficient avoidance of death, it might choose symbiosis with MAGI. / But how...?
grammar: を考えれば - conditional with 考える ('if one considers')

text: 目標がコンピューターそのものなら、カスパーを使徒に直結
translation: If the target is a computer itself, we directly connect Casper to the Angel.

vocabulary.meaning: Casper (one of the three MAGI computers)

grammar: なら conditional - 'if X is the case' (softer than ならば)

text: 逆ハックを仕掛けて、自滅促進プログラムを送り込むことができます / が…
translation: We can launch a reverse hack and send in a self-destruction acceleration program... but...
grammar: ことができます - potential form using こと + できる ('it is possible to...')

text: 同時に、使徒に対しても防壁を解放することにもなります / カスパーが早いか、首都が早いか、勝負だな / はい、そのプログラム間に合うんでしょうね
translation: At the same time, it also means releasing our defenses against the Angel. / It's a race - whether Casper is faster or the Angel. / Yes, the program will be ready in time, right?

vocabulary.meaning: to be in time, to make it

grammar: ことにもなります - 'it also becomes the case that...' (unintended consequence)

text: カスパーまで犯されたら終わりなのよ
translation: If even Casper is violated, it's all over.
grammar: 犯されたら - passive conditional ('if it is violated')

text: 約束は守るわ / R警 / 報発令、R警報発令 / ベルフ本部内部に緊急事態が発生しました / D級勤務者は全員退避してください
translation: I'll keep my promise. / R-Alert issued, R-Alert issued. / An emergency has occurred inside NERV headquarters. / All D-class personnel, please evacuate.
grammar: てください - polite request form ('please do...')

text: な、なんですか?これ
translation: Wh-what is this?
grammar: Stuttering (な、なん) indicates surprise or shock in Japanese speech

text: 開発者のいたずら書きだわ / すごい!裏コードだ! / マギの裏コードですよ!これ / さながら / マギの裏技大特集ってわけね / ああ、 / こんなの見ちゃっていいのかしら?
translation: It's the developer's doodles. / Amazing! It's hidden code! / This is MAGI's hidden code! / It's like... / A special feature on MAGI's secret tricks, huh. / Oh, is it okay for us to see this?
grammar: 見ちゃっていいのかしら - ちゃう (casual てしまう) + いいのかしら (feminine wondering 'is it okay?')

text: ああ、びっくり!これなんて、イントのシーンよ!
translation: Oh, what a surprise! This is an initialization scene!
grammar: なんて - exclamatory particle expressing surprise or emphasis

text: これなら、意外と早くプログラムできますね、先輩!
translation: With this, we can program it surprisingly quickly, senpai!
grammar: これなら - 'if it's this' or 'with this' conditional

text: うん。
translation: Yeah.
grammar: Casual affirmative response

text: ありがとう、母さん。確実に間に合うわ。
translation: Thank you, Mother. We'll definitely make it in time.
grammar: わ - feminine sentence-ending particle adding assertion

text: レンチ取って。
translation: Hand me the wrench.
grammar: 取って - te-form used as casual imperative/request

text: 大学の頃を思い出すわね / 25番のボード
translation: This reminds me of our college days. / Board number 25.
grammar: を思い出す - 'to recall/remember X'

text: ねえ、少しは教えてよマギのこと / 長い話よ
translation: Hey, tell me a little about MAGI. / It's a long story.
grammar: 少しは - 'at least a little' (は adds emphasis on the minimum)

text: その割に面白くない話
translation: A not-so-interesting story for its length.
grammar: その割に - 'considering that' or 'for all that' - indicates something is disproportionate to expectations

text: 人格移植OSって知ってる? / ええ。第7世代の有機コンピューターに個人の人格を移植して試行させるシステム。 / エヴァーの操縦にも使われている技術よね。
translation: Do you know about personality transplant OS? / Yes. A system that transplants an individual's personality into 7th generation organic computers to make them think. / It's the technology used in Eva piloting too, right?
grammar: って知ってる - casual way of asking 'do you know about X?' (って = quotative particle)

text: マギはその第1号らしいわ。
translation: MAGI seems to be the first one of those.
grammar: らしい - hearsay/conjecture marker ('apparently', 'seems like')

text: お母さんが開発した技術なのよ。
translation: It's technology that her mother developed.
grammar: が開発した技術 - relative clause modifying 技術 ('technology that [someone] developed')

text: じゃあ、お母さんの人格を移植したの? / そう。
translation: So, she transplanted her mother's personality? / That's right.
grammar: したの? - past tense + の for seeking confirmation (feminine/casual question)

text: 言ってみればこれは / 母さんの脳みそそのものなのよ
translation: In other words, this is... / Mother's brain itself.

vocabulary.meaning: so to speak, in other words

grammar: 言ってみれば - set phrase meaning 'so to speak' or 'in a manner of speaking'

text: それでマニを守りたかったの / 違うと思うわ
translation: So you wanted to protect MAGI? / I don't think so.

vocabulary.meaning: to be different, to be wrong

grammar: 守りたかった - past tense of たい form (wanted to protect)

text: 母さんのことそんなに好きじゃなかったから / 科学者としての判断ね
translation: I didn't like Mother that much. / It was a judgment as a scientist.
grammar: としての - 'as a...' indicating role or capacity

text: 来た! / バルタダールが乗っ取られました!
translation: It's coming! / Balthasar has been taken over!

vocabulary.meaning: Balthasar (one of the three MAGI computers)

grammar: 乗っ取られました - passive form indicating 'was taken over' (suffered the action)

text: 人工知能により自立自爆が決議されました / 始まったの? / 発想時は3社一致の後、0人秒で行われます
translation: The self-destruct has been decided by the artificial intelligence. / Has it begun? / The detonation will occur 0 seconds after unanimous agreement by all three.
grammar: Passive voice with により (by means of) indicates the agent performing the action in formal/technical speech.

text: 自爆範囲は中い度深度280、140、0フロアです特例 / 5、8、2、発動をかむため / マル / タザル、さら
translation: The self-destruct range is central depth 280, 140, floor 0. Special provision 582 is activated. / Balthasar, further...
grammar: Technical announcement style using です for formal declarations in emergency situations.

text: にカッパーに侵入 / 押 / されてるぞ、なんて速度だ
translation: It's invading Caspar! / We're being pushed back! What speed!
grammar: なんて + noun is an exclamatory expression showing surprise or amazement (What [noun]!).

text: 自爆装置作動まであと20秒 / いかん!カスパー!18秒後に乗っ取られます! / 自爆装置作動まであと15秒 / リ / ツコ!急いで! / 大丈夫?
translation: 20 seconds until self-destruct activation. / No good! Caspar will be taken over in 18 seconds! / 15 seconds until self-destruct activation. / Ritsuko! Hurry! / Are you okay?
grammar: まで + あと + time expression indicates countdown (X time left until...).

text: 1秒近くも余裕があるわ / 1秒って! / 0のマ / イナスじゃない
translation: We have nearly a whole second to spare. / One second?! / That's not even zero minus!
grammar: も after a quantity adds emphasis, often implying 'as much as' or sarcastically 'only'.

text: マヤ!いけます! / 4秒!3秒!2秒!1秒!0秒!
translation: Maya! We can do it! / 4 seconds! 3 seconds! 2 seconds! 1 second! 0 seconds!

vocabulary.meaning: to be able to do, to work out

grammar: いけます is the polite potential form of いく used idiomatically to mean 'it will work' or 'we can make it'.

text: 人工知能により自立自爆が解除されました
translation: The autonomous self-destruct has been cancelled by the artificial intelligence.
grammar: により marks the agent in passive constructions in formal/written Japanese.

text: なお特例582も解除されました
translation: Additionally, Special Provision 582 has also been cancelled.
grammar: なお is a formal conjunction used in announcements to add supplementary information.

text: マギシステム通常モードに戻ります
translation: The MAGI system is returning to normal mode.
grammar: に戻る means 'to return to (a state)' - に marks the destination/state being returned to.

text: R警報解除 / R警報解除
translation: R-alert cancelled. R-alert cancelled.
grammar: Noun + noun compounds without particles are common in announcements and headlines for brevity.

text: 総員第一種警戒態勢に移行してください / 何がどうなってんだろう
translation: All personnel, please transition to Level 1 alert status. / What's going on, I wonder?
grammar: どうなってんだろう is casual contraction of どうなっているんだろう, expressing wondering/puzzlement.

text: もう裸じゃどこにも出れないじゃないの
translation: I can't go out anywhere naked anymore!
grammar: じゃ is casual contraction of では; じゃないの at end expresses complaint or frustration.

text: 早く誰か助けて
translation: Someone help me, quickly!
grammar: Te-form alone (助けて) functions as an urgent request/command, more desperate than 助けてください.

text: シグマユニット開放 / マギシステム再開まで / マイナスゼロサンです
translation: Sigma Unit opened. / Until MAGI system restart: / minus zero-three.
grammar: まで indicates 'until' a point in time; countdown announcements often use まで + time remaining.

text: もう年かしらね / 徹夜が答えるわ / また約束守ってくれたわね / お疲れさん
translation: I wonder if I'm getting old. / Pulling all-nighters is taking its toll. / You kept your promise again. / Good work.
grammar: かしらね is feminine sentence-ending expressing wondering or uncertainty, softer than かな.

text: ありがとう
translation: Thank you.
grammar: Simple expression of gratitude; more casual than ありがとうございます.

text: ミサトの入れてくれたコーヒーを / こんなに美味いと思ったのは初めてだわ
translation: This is the first time I've thought / the coffee Misato made was this good.
grammar: てくれた indicates someone did something for the speaker's benefit (making coffee for her).

text: 死ぬ前の晩母さんが言ってたわ / マギは三人の自分なんだって
translation: The night before she died, my mother said / that MAGI is three versions of herself.
grammar: んだって is casual quotative, reporting what someone said (= と言っていた).

text: 科学者としての自分 / 母としての自分 / 女としての自分
translation: Herself as a scientist. / Herself as a mother. / Herself as a woman.
grammar: として means 'as' (in the role/capacity of); としての + noun = 'as a [noun]'.

text: その三人が攻めき合っているのがマギなのよ
translation: MAGI is those three arguing with each other.
grammar: Verb stem + 合う indicates mutual/reciprocal action (arguing with each other).

text: 人の持つジレンマをわざと残したのね / 実はプログラムを微妙に変えてあるのよ
translation: She deliberately left in the dilemmas that humans have. / Actually, I've slightly modified the program.
grammar: てある indicates a resultant state from a deliberate action (the program has been changed and remains so).

text: 私は母親にはなれそうもないから / 母としての母さんはわからないわ
translation: Since I probably won't become a mother myself, / I don't understand my mother as a mother.
grammar: そうもない expresses strong doubt that something will happen (unlikely to become).

text: だけど科学者としてのあの人は尊敬もしていた
translation: But I did respect her as a scientist.
grammar: も after 尊敬 adds nuance of 'even' or 'also' - implying other feelings existed alongside respect.

text: でもね、女としては憎んでさえいたの
translation: But as a woman, I even hated her.
grammar: さえ means 'even' and emphasizes an extreme case - she went so far as to hate her.

text: 今日はおしゃべりじゃない / たまにはね
translation: You're talkative today. / Once in a while.
grammar: じゃない here is observational (You're talkative, aren't you?) not negative.

text: カスパーにはね / 女としてのパターンがインプットされていたの
translation: In Caspar, you see, / the pattern of herself as a woman was inputted.
grammar: されていた is past progressive passive - 'had been inputted' indicating completed past action.

text: 最後まで女でいることを守ったのね / ほんと、母さんらしいわ
translation: She protected being a woman until the very end. / That's really just like my mother.
grammar: Noun + らしい means 'typical of' or 'just like' that noun (母さんらしい = so like mother).

text: 致命中
translation: [Episode title card] Fatal Hit / To Be Continued
grammar: This appears to be an episode title or preview card text.
